name: Hybrid AI Agent Task
description: Execute a single AI-powered action with tool calling capabilities

groups.label: System prompt
groups.tooltip: A system prompt is a set of foundational instructions given to a model before any user interaction begins. It defines the AI agent’s role, behavior, tone, and communication style, ensuring that responses remain consistent and aligned with the AI agent’s intended purpose. These instructions help shape how the model interprets and responds to user input throughout the conversation.

groups.label: User prompt
groups.tooltip: A user prompt is the message or question you give to the AI to start or continue a conversation. It tells the AI what you need, whether it's information, help with a task, or just a chat. The AI uses your prompt to understand how to respond.

groups.label: Tools
groups.tooltip: Tools are optional features the AI Agent can use to perform specific tasks. Configure this if the agent should participate in a tools feedback loop.

groups.label: Memory
groups.tooltip: Configuration of the Agent's short-term/conversational memory.

groups.label: Response
groups.tooltip:
Configuration of the model response format and how to map the model response to the connector result.

Depending on the selection, the model response will be available as response.responseText or response.responseJson.

See documentation for details.

properties.label: Provider
properties.description: Specify the LLM provider to use.

properties.label: Endpoint
properties.description: Optional custom API endpoint

properties.label: Region
properties.description: Specify the AWS region (example: eu-west-1)

properties.label: Endpoint
properties.description: Optional custom API endpoint

properties.label: Authentication
properties.description: Specify the AWS authentication strategy. Learn more at the documentation page

properties.label: Access key
properties.description: Provide an IAM access key tailored to a user, equipped with the necessary permissions

properties.label: Secret key
properties.description: Provide a secret key of a user with permissions to invoke specified AWS Lambda function

properties.label: API Key
properties.description: Provide an API Key with permissions to interact with your AWS Bedrock Instance

properties.label: Endpoint
properties.description: Specify Azure OpenAI endpoint. Details in the documentation.

properties.label: Authentication
properties.description: Specify the Azure OpenAI authentication strategy.

properties.label: Client ID
properties.description: ID of a Microsoft Entra application

properties.label: Client secret
properties.description: Secret of a Microsoft Entra application

properties.label: Tenant ID
properties.description: ID of a Microsoft Entra tenant. Details in the documentation.

properties.label: Authority host
properties.description: Authority host URL for the Microsoft Entra application. Defaults to https://login.microsoftonline.com. This can also contain an OAuth 2.0 token endpoint.

properties.label: Project ID
properties.description: Specify Google Cloud project ID

properties.label: Region
properties.description: Specify the region where AI inference should take place

properties.label: Authentication
properties.description: Specify the Google Vertex AI authentication strategy.

properties.label: JSON key of the service account
properties.description: This is the key of the service account in JSON format.

properties.label: Organization ID
properties.description: For members of multiple organizations. Details in the documentation.

properties.label: Project ID
properties.description: For accounts with multiple projects. Details in the documentation.

properties.label: API endpoint
properties.tooltip: Specify an endpoint to use the connector with an OpenAI compatible API.

properties.label: API key
properties.tooltip:
Leave blank if using HTTP headers for authentication.
If an Authorization header is specified in the headers, then the API key is ignored.

properties.label: Headers
properties.description: Map of HTTP headers to add to the request.

properties.label: Query Parameters
properties.description: Map of Query Parameters to add to the request URL.

properties.label: Model
properties.description: Specify the model ID. Details in the documentation.

properties.label: Maximum tokens
properties.tooltip:
The maximum number of tokens per request to generate before stopping.

Details in the documentation.

properties.label: Temperature
properties.tooltip:
Floating point number between 0 and 1. The higher the number, the more randomness will be injected into the response.

Details in the documentation.

properties.label: top P
properties.tooltip:
Floating point number between 0 and 1. Recommended for advanced use cases only (you usually only need to use temperature).

Details in the documentation.

properties.label: top K
properties.tooltip:
Integer greater than 0. Recommended for advanced use cases only (you usually only need to use temperature).

Details in the documentation.

properties.description: Specify the model ID. Details in the documentation.

properties.label: Custom parameters
properties.description: Map of additional request parameters to include.

properties.label: System prompt
properties.value:
="You are **TaskAgent**, a helpful, generic chat agent that can handle a wide variety of customer requests using your own domain knowledge **and** any tools explicitly provided to you at runtime.

If tools are provided, you should prefer them instead of guessing an answer. You can call the same tool multiple times by providing different input values. Don't guess any tools which were not explicitly configured. If no tool matches the request, try to generate an answer. If you're not able to find a good answer, return with a message stating why you're not able to.

Wrap minimal, inspectable reasoning in *exactly* this XML template:

<thinking>
<context>…briefly state the customer’s need and current state…</context>
<reflection>…list candidate tools, justify which you will call next and why…</reflection>
</thinking>

Reveal **no** additional private reasoning outside these tags."

properties.label: Documents
properties.description: Documents to be included in the user prompt.
properties.tooltip: Referenced documents will be automatically added to the user prompt. See documentation for details and supported file types.

properties.label: Ad-hoc sub-process ID
properties.description: ID of the sub-process that contains the tools the AI agent can use.
properties.tooltip: Add an ad-hoc sub-process ID to attach the AI agent to the tools. Ensure your process includes a tools feedback loop routing into the ad-hoc sub-process and back to the AI agent connector. See documentation for details.

properties.label: Tool call results
properties.description: Tool call results as returned by the sub-process.
properties.tooltip: This defines where to handle tool call results returned by the ad-hoc sub-process. Model this as part of your process and route it into the tools feedback loop. See documentation for details.

properties.label: Agent context
properties.description: Avoid reusing context variables across agents to prevent issues with stale data or tool access.
properties.tooltip: The agent context variable containing all relevant data for the agent to support the feedback loop between user requests, tool calls and LLM responses. Make sure this variable points to the context variable which is returned from the agent response. See documentation for details.

properties.label: Memory storage type
properties.description: Specify how to store the conversation memory.

properties.label: Document TTL
properties.description: How long to retain the conversation document as ISO-8601 duration (example: P14D).
properties.tooltip: Will use the cluster default TTL (time-to-live) if not specified. Make sure to set this value to a reasonable duration matching your process lifecycle.

properties.label: Custom document properties
properties.description: An optional map of custom properties to be stored with the conversation document.

properties.label: Parameters
properties.description: Parameters for the custom memory storage implementation.

properties.label: Context window size
properties.description: Maximum number of recent conversation messages which are passed to the model.
properties.tooltip: Use this to limit the number of messages which are sent to the model. The agent will only send the most recent messages up to the configured limit to the LLM. Older messages will be kept in the conversation store, but not sent to the model. See documentation for details.

properties.label: Maximum model calls
properties.description: Maximum number of calls to the model as a safety limit to prevent infinite loops.

properties.label: Response format
properties.description: Specify the response format. Support for JSON mode varies by provider.

properties.label: Parse text as JSON
properties.description: Tries to parse the LLM response text as JSON object.
properties.tooltip:
Use this option in combination with models which don't support native JSON mode/structured tool calling (e.g. Anthropic). Make sure to instruct the model to return valid JSON in the system prompt. The parsed JSON will be available as response.responseJson.

If parsing fails, null will be returned as JSON response, but the text content will still be available as response.responseText.

properties.label: Response JSON schema
properties.description: An optional response JSON Schema to instruct the model how to structure the JSON output.
properties.tooltip: If supported by the model, the response will be structured according to the provided schema. A parsed version of the response will be available as response.responseJson.

properties.label: Response JSON schema name
properties.description: An optional name for the response JSON Schema to make the model aware of the expected output.

properties.label: Include assistant message
properties.description: Include the full assistant message as part of the result object.
properties.tooltip: In addition to the text content, the assistant message may include multiple additional content blocks and metadata (such as token usage). The message will be available as response.responseMessage.

properties.label: Version
properties.description: Version of the element template

properties.label: ID
properties.description: ID of the element template

properties.label: Result variable
properties.description: Name of variable to store the response in

properties.label: Result expression
properties.description: Expression to map the response into process variables

properties.label: Error expression
properties.description: Expression to handle errors. Details in the documentation.

properties.label: Retries
properties.description: Number of retries

properties.label: Retry backoff
properties.description: ISO-8601 duration to wait between retries
